docs.title: ParamTatva Research Center
docs.text:
CERN-grade particle & field simulation/reconstruction, built on the ParamTatva fundamental string concept: two engines (native fast + Geant4/ACTS interop), always-green physics tests, deterministic runs, and Sanskrit-forward configuration.

TL;DR

  • pip install -e pt-sim
  • pytest -q to verify the core physics unit tests
  • mkdocs serve for these docs

See Getting Started → Quickstart to run the Week-1 demo.

docs.title: Data & IOV (Conditions)
docs.text: We maintain a sqlite-backed Conditions DB keyed by tags and validity intervals (IOVs). APIs: conditions.get(tag, time, key) with local caching. See Week-2 deliverables.

docs.title: Dev Environment
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • Optional Rust toolchain for pt-core (Rust 1.75+)
  • Recommended: micromamba or uv for reproducible envs

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text:
• pt-core/: Rust kernels (steppers, hot loops, benches) exposed via PyO3.
  • pt-sim/: Python SDK and orchestration.
  • Optional plugins: Geant4 backend, ACTS tracking.

Design tenets: modular, testable, deterministic, interop-first (HepMC3/ROOT/GDML).

docs.title: EM Showers v1
docs.text:
• Longitudinal gamma-profile normalized to energy
  • Lateral via Molière radius approximation
  • Energy-closure tests enforce |Σcell−E|/E < 0.5% (no noise)

docs.title: Materials & dE/dx
docs.text:
• Bethe–Bloch energy loss with material mixing
  • Highland multiple scattering
  • Material tables sourced from PDG 2024 (Week-3)

docs.title: Transport & Steppers
docs.text:
• Boris pusher (non/relativistic) with half E-kicks and B rotation.
  • Acceptance tests: speed conservation in uniform B; helix radius vs analytic.

Next: curvature-based adaptive dt; Vay variant for high β.

docs.title: Week 1 — Relativistic-ready Boris & Test Scaffolding
docs.text:
Deliverables - Boris pusher (Python) + analytic helix helpers - Tests: speed conservation, radius check; EM energy closure - I/O stubs (ROOT/HepMC3 fall back to npz/ascii)

Exit criteria - pytest -q green - Demo spiral stable with dt guard

Run ```bash cd pt-sim && pip install -e . pytest -q

docs.title: Week 2 — γ refresh, field maps, Conditions DB
docs.text:
Deliverables: - Relativistic Boris (γ refresh), uniform/gradient field map API - sqlite Conditions DB with IOV tags (gains, pedestals, B/E maps)

Exit criteria: - Helix residual < 1e-6 - Conditions fetch latency < 0.1 ms (cached)

docs.title: Week 3 — Materials & GDML stub
docs.text:
Deliverables: - Bethe–Bloch dE/dx; Highland scattering - PDG-based materials; GDML loader stub → in-memory volumes

Exit criteria: - dE/dx curves match PDG within 2–5%
